physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient appeared to be well and was active. Notable findings included proptosis with inferior and medial deviation of the right eye, bruising and edema of the eyelid, and limited eye movement. No purulent discharge or conjunctival injection was observed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially, proptosis was present with subsequent marked worsening of proptosis six days after initiation of chemotherapy, attributed to edema from treatment-induced necrosis. After treatment with dexamethasone, the proptosis improved.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: On evaluation three months post-diagnosis, the patient was pale but appeared well and was crawling actively. Mild periorbital swelling of the right eye was noted, with the left eye normal. No lymphadenopathy was present, and other examination findings were unremarkable.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The proptosis lessened after chemotherapy and radiation therapy, showing decreased mass effect on adjacent structures.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Fourteen months after diagnosis, an MRI showed only a very small residual soft-tissue mass, which was unchanged in size.
